div.script: components.addItem("unifiedPublishingAlert");

img.title: Alert
img.a: Distance Learning officially kicks off on Monday, April 20

div.p: Distance Learning officially kicks off on Monday, April 20. So what’s distance learning and what can parents and families do to help children make the most of learning from home? Find out more about this new way of learning at www.sbcusd.com/distancelearning. Remember, our schools may be closed but student learning continues across the San Bernardino City Unified School District. Visit www.sbcusd.com/distancelearning for more helpful information. We’re all in this together. Los estudios a distancia empiezan oficialmente el lunes 20 de abril. ¿Qué son los estudios a distancia y qué pueden hacer los padres y las familias para ayudar a los niños a beneficiarse de ellos en casa? Entérese más sobre esta nueva manera para aprender en www.sbcusd.com/distancelearning. Recuerde, nuestras escuelas están cerradas pero la educación continúa en todo el Distrito Escolar Unificado de la Ciudad de San Bernardino. Visite www.sbcusd.com/distancelearning para mayor información. Lo superaremos juntos.

link.script: renderEmergencyMsg("Distance Learning officially kicks off on Monday, April 20", "2020/03/13", "2020/04/05");

a.title: All SBCUSD school campuses will remain closed through the end of the school year, and we will transition to a distance learning platform for all students.

img.title: #892487032e4f40ec836357c96838c77b
img.alt: All SBCUSD school campuses will remain closed through the end of the school year, and we will transition to a distance learning platform for all students.

a.title: SBCUSD will continue providing free breakfast and lunch to all children. For any questions or concerns, please dial (909) 381-1224.

img.title: #43cbde7c7dfe4684ac7d1f36f3bc41a9
img.alt: SBCUSD will continue providing free breakfast and lunch to all children. For any questions or concerns, please dial (909) 381-1224.

a.title: Help Slow the Spread of COVID-19. San Bernardino County has a new health order calling for everyone to wear face coverings while out in public. For more information, please visit: sbcusd.com/covid19

div.p: All SBCUSD school campuses will remain closed through the end of the school year, and we will transition to a distance learning platform for all students.
SBCUSD will continue providing free breakfast and lunch to all children. For any questions or concerns, please dial (909) 381-1224.
Help Slow the Spread of COVID-19. San Bernardino County has a new health order calling for everyone to wear face coverings while out in public. For more information, please visit: sbcusd.com/covid19
Home Internet for ONLY $10-$23 a month! For a limited time some providers are offering 2 months free. Click this image for MORE INFORMATION.
Dial 1-800-273-TALK (8255) or visit suicidepreventionlifeline.org for access to the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline
Still need an electronic device or need help troubleshooting a device for Distance Learning? On Wednesday, April 22 and Thursday, April 23, please come to our six convenient locations

div.h2:
The San Bernardino City Unified School District
MISSION STATEMENT

p.span:
The mission of SBCUSD, the leading expert in human learning, is to ensure all students, cradle to career, develop the knowledge, skills, and proficiencies required for college, career, civic, and economic success by inspiring and engaging them in a system distinguished by:
High expectations for student and staff performance; Vital partnerships with families, community, and employers; Culturally proficient schools; Learning experiences beyond traditional boundaries of where and when; Safe, respectful, and welcoming environments.

link.p: 777 North F Street, San Bernardino, CA 92410 | Phone: (909) 381-1100 | Fax:
